overview: From 2025-11-01 to 2025-12-01, elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp had 1 new PRs (1 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Update action names and dependencies
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Changes

- Rename `CALL_TOOL` action to `CALL_MCP_TOOL` with backward compatibility (similes)
- Rename `READ_RESOURCE` action to `READ_MCP_RESOURCE` with backward compatibility (similes)
- Update `@elizaos/core` dependency to ^1.5.4
- Update version to 1.2.0
- Update all references to action names in error handling and handlers

## Backward Compatibility

Both action names maintain backward compatibility through the `similes` array, so existing code referencing the old names will continue to work.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Renames MCP action names (with backward-compatible aliases), updates references and docs, and bumps @elizaos/core with a version release to 1.2.0.
> 
> - **Actions**:
>   - Rename `CALL_TOOL` → `CALL_MCP_TOOL` and `READ_RESOURCE` → `READ_MCP_RESOURCE` in `src/actions/*` with backward-compatible `similes`.
>   - Update returned `data.actionName` and validations; add explicit `McpServer` typing.
> - **Error/Handler**:
>   - Update action name strings in `src/utils/error.ts` and `src/utils/handler.ts`.
> - **Docs**:
>   - Update README action names and flow diagram to `CALL_MCP_TOOL`/`READ_MCP_RESOURCE`.
> - **Dependencies**:
>   - Bump `@elizaos/core` to `^1.5.4` (lockfile refreshed).
> - **Release**:
>   - Bump package version to `1.2.0` in `package.json`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit e9df1b5d9a5c56d03c042921cab36029d7847f21. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Updated core dependency to support enhanced MCP integration.

* **Documentation**
  * Renamed actions with clearer naming convention for improved clarity.
  * Updated flow diagrams to reflect new action identifiers.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Maintained backward compatibility with legacy action names.

* **Chores**
  * Bumped package version to 1.2.0.
  * Enhanced type annotations for improved code stability.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

completedItems.title: Update action names and dependencies
completedItems.body:
## Changes

- Rename `CALL_TOOL` action to `CALL_MCP_TOOL` with backward compatibility (similes)
- Rename `READ_RESOURCE` action to `READ_MCP_RESOURCE` with backward compatibility (similes)
- Update `@elizaos/core` dependency to ^1.5.4
- Up

topContributors.summary: standujar: Focused on significant feature development, opening a pull request to implement entity-level row level security in elizaos/eliza (#6107). This substantial work involved changes to 31 files and added over 1500 lines of code. All of their activity this month was concentrated on this single feature.

0xbbjoker: This month, 0xbbjoker focused on extending plugin functionality by opening a pull request to add text embedding model support to the OpenRouter plugin (elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter#17). This feature work involved changes across 9 files, including both application code and corresponding tests. The contribution demonstrates a clear focus on expanding feature capabilities within the plugin ecosystem.

wtfsayo: This month, wtfsayo focused on maintenance and refactoring within the `elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp` repository. Their sole merged pull request, #18, updated action names and dependencies, resulting in a significant code cleanup that removed over 400 lines. This work involved an even split of feature, bugfix, and other tasks, touching code, documentation, and configuration files.

ai16x402: This month, ai16x402 focused on expanding the plugin ecosystem by opening three pull requests in elizaos-plugins/registry (#239, #238, #237) to add new plugins. Their contributions consisted of 7 commits modifying configuration files to support these additions. They also left 3 comments on pull requests.
